summary.body: Does anyone know why the estate have started locking the recycling bins. If this is supposed to police recycling it does not work.   This weekend I saw people take stuff down for the recycling bins but then use the ordinary waste bins because the recycling bins were locked.
summary.subject: Locked recycling bins

summary.body: I wonder if the complete absence of litter bins on the podium, except for those in the Speed House andd Defore gardens, bothers anyone? There are times that litter accumulates to such a degree that I yearn for that long gone receptical that at one time was seen round about and many time full to overflowing.        I realize our litter bins were removed about the time the IRA were using both litter bins and post boxes to house their explosives in their dastardly campaign in England. But since the troubles, and the long awaited answer to the final solution, things have taken a turn for the better I would assume the recepticals might effect a long awaited return.         I've inquired, of the Corporation on a number of occasions, when   might the bins again appear and on each instance came the reply ' we are in the process of perfecting a bomb proof litter bin '!!! Remembering the year of my first inquiry, 1998 I believe, finding the material and answer to this problem seems so far to escaped their search.          Very possibly I won't have the pleasure of seeing the bins in my lifetime but I hope for those who follow me here on the Estate litter hopefully will if not be a thing of the past at least will be lessened. Am I asking too much and are there any comments out there?
summary.subject: The long absent litter bin!
